page.title: 10Poultry Farming
page.content: The 250 000 chickens produce 1.4 million eggs a week. If any of these are cracked they are put in a centrifuge to separate the eggs from the shell and are then sold to a local baker. The temperature is kept at a constant 70 deg. F. Should the temperature rise by 1 deg. F the chickens would eat an extra gram of food per day. Then the food bill would rise by Â£8 000 a year. The normal food bill is Â£30 000 a week. All the chicken waste drops onto the conveyor-belts directly under the cages. It is then scooped up and sold to local farmers as fertilizer. The chickens are fed on a mixture of 72 different ingredients, the main ones being Maize and Wheat. They are also supplied with water.
